meanings.sent1: She always tends to overplay her achievements.
meanings.sent2: Don't overplay the importance of small mistakes.
meanings.sent3: He overplayed his reaction to the surprise party, pretending to faint.
meanings.sent4: The news anchor tends to overplay the severity of minor incidents.
meanings.sent5: The actor's performance was so overplayed that it became comical.

meanings.sent1: Try not to overplay your hand in the negotiation.
meanings.sent2: It's easy to overplay your favorite song until you get tired of it.
meanings.sent3: She overplayed her love for chocolate by eating a whole cake in one sitting.
meanings.sent4: The chef accidentally overplayed the salt in the soup, making it too salty.
meanings.sent5: He tends to overplay his enthusiasm for video games by playing for hours on end.

meanings.definition: To act in an exaggerated or excessive manner.
meanings.sent1: The comedian tends to overplay his jokes for extra laughs.
meanings.sent2: Don't overplay your disappointment; it's not a big deal.
meanings.sent3: She overplayed her fear of spiders by screaming at the sight of a tiny one.
meanings.sent4: The politician's attempt to overplay his achievements backfired with the voters.
meanings.sent5: The children overplayed their excitement at the amusement park, running around in circles.
